sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A second part of the religious demurrer; by another hand. Or, an answer to a tract called The lawfullnesse of obeying the present government. / By a lover of truth and peace. Lover of truth and peace. Ward, Nathaniel, 1578-1652.
8 p.
printed for Thomas Underhill, [London : 1649]
The first part was by Nathaniel Ward. "The lawfulnes of obeying the present government" is by Francis Rous. Caption title. Imprint from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy: "against Mr Rous"; "printed by Tho: Underhill June 6 1649". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
A second part of the religious demurrer; by another hand. Or, an answer to a tract called The lawfullnesse of obeying the present government. / By a lover of truth and peace. Lover of truth and peace. Ward, Nathaniel, 1578-1652.
8 p.
printed for Thomas Underhill, [London : 1649]
The first part was by Nathaniel Ward. "The lawfulnes of obeying the present government" is by Francis Rous. Caption title. Imprint from Wing. Annotation on Thomason copy: "against Mr Rous"; "printed by Tho: Underhill June 6 1649". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Thomas Underhill
